resources.string: TouchTone
This is a test string.
feeling unpleasantly shocked or disgusted
feeling a combination of anger and disgust
feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements and advantages
feeling bitter or angry about something you think is unfair
seriously offended
bothered by something displeasing or uncomfortable
upset because you cannot do something you want to do
very troubled and restless
being unfriendly or opposed to someone or something
intense dislike for something or someone
feeling of intense pleasure or joy
filled with delight
being in great joy
feeling full of joy
feeling lifted by joy
intense happiness and s sense of wellbeing
great energy or enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or an objective
enthusiastic about something in the future
optimistic that something good will happen
impatiently wanting to do or get something
well known or famous
achieved something important to you
good-humored cheerfulness
finding something funny or entertaining
pleased with what you have or with something you did
feeling content and happy about a particular situation or person
quiet and calm; free from disturbance
feeling at ease after an unpleasant feeling goes away
showing care and concern for someone
displaying kindness and concern for others
intense passion or admiration for someone or something
intense engagement and commitment to someone or something
having a liking for or interest in someone or something
of or prompted by feelings of tenderness, sadness, or nostalgia
affection or liking for someone or something
conducive to or characterized by the expression of love
experiencing extreme surprise
feeling confused or astounded by an event
disappointed in someone or something that one discovers to be less good than one had believed
completely baffled and puzzled
greatly surprised or impressed
very impressed and amazed by something
unable to speak as the temporary result of shock or some strong emotion
shock or greatly surprise
made excited and interested about something
being emotionally stirred or moved
extreme and prolonged pain and suffering
mental or emotional distress or anguish
extremely unhappy and dispirited
intense sadness
feelings of alarmed concern or dismay
feeling annoyance and displeasure
feeling bad when you do something that you wish you had not
feeling responsible for a specific wrongdoing
feeling like you are cut off from others
feeling sad because you are alone or disconnected
experiencing distress when losing someone or something important
feeling of helplessness or inadequacy in stressful situations
anxiety because of expecting something unpleasant or upsetting
feeling or showing strong shame or embarrassment
worried and uneasy about an uncertain outcome
troubled about actual or potential problems
feeling that who you are is insufficient or lacking in some way
feeling of being less important or valuable
deriving from or affected by uncontrolled extreme emotion
feeling frantic and overcome by fear and anxiety
feeling like there is nothing you can do
afraid or fearful
